title: Rope
subject_group: Literature/American literature - Film and video adaptations
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Gay and lesbian studies
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Homosexuality in motion pictures
description: John Dall and Farley Granger play flat mates (and implied homosexual lovers to those in the know) who strangle a friend for intellectual thrills and proceed to invite the victim's family and friends for dinner, believing they have committed the perfect crime. Their former teacher, James Stewart, suspects wrongdoing and by the end of the evening discovers how brutally his students have twisted his own academic theories to justify the murder. Based on the Patrick Hamilton play that dealt with the Leopold-Loeb murder.
